Eight members of a family killed after c.description: AGRA: Eight members of a family were killed on Sunday after the car they were travelling in bumped into a truck from behind on Yamuna Expressway in UP's Mathura district. The victims hailed from Jewar of Gautambudh Nagar district and Khurja (Pahasu) of Bulandshahr, and were heading to Agra to visit Taj Mahal, when their hatchback allegedly rammed into rear end of a truck registered with Karnataka RTO. According to police, the accident occurred at around 8.40am near milestone 140 under Baldeo police jurisdiction of Mathura district. The deceased were identified as Neeraj (25) wife of Prem Chand, Anita (30) wife of Shiv Kumar, Anjali (13) daughter of Shiv Kumar, Vishnu (25) son of Suresh, Karuna (22) daughter of Sulekh, Shalu (19) daughter of Jai Prakash, Santoshi (20) and Gabbar Singh (25) son of Brahm Singh. Speaking to TOI, Major (retried) Manish Singh, in-charge, coordinator, Yamuna Expressway said, “The hatchback was probably cruising at a very high speed, there was nothing intact in the mangled car. Expressway rescue team which reached the location in nearly six minutes, found six bodies along with two grievously injured trapped inside the car. We immediately rushed the victims to nearest hospital.” Sunil Kumar Singh, station house officer of Baldeo said, “The car had rammed into rear of a truck, which suggest either the car’s driver felt asleep on steering wheel, or the truck driver applied sudden brakes in middle of the road. After the accident, the truck driver along with his vehicle fled away. The registration number of the truck was found from the accident spot, which was registered with Karnataka RTO.” “The bodies have been sent for autopsy and an FIR has been launched,” he added. Talking to TOI, Prem Chand, husband of deceased Neeraj, said, “Around 16 members of our distant family were heading to Agra to visit Taj Mahal in two cars via Yamuna expressway. We all had left for Agra from Khurja on Saturday night and had brief stay at my in-law’s home in Naujheel of Mathura district. On Sunday morning, we resumed our journey. I was driving my van and ferrying all male members of the family including my two children. When the accident happened we were nearly 10-12km away from hatchback and had no idea about the tragedy.” “All eight members of my family including my wife, niece and friend were killed,” said Prem Chand who runs a small store of electrical items in Jewar. In another road accident on Yamuna expressway on Sunday early morning at around 12.53am, a sedan rammed into an iron railing and turn-turtle. The accident occurred at 156 milestone of Khandauli police jurisdiction of Agra district. According to police, the four victims in the car hailed from Delhi and were heading Bihar to attend a wedding ceremony. One of the victims identified as Pawan Bhambhani (35) succumbed to his injuries during treatment in hospital. While his three friends, Lalit Thapa, Arun Bhewal and Manto were injured. According to rescue team of the expressway, the turtled sedan was later hit by another overspeeding car. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Councilors question quality, delay in sm.description: AGRA: The board of councilors of Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) raised objections over quality and delay of works under the smart city project during a special meeting on Saturday. Issues relating to irregularities in tax collection, lack of proper cleanliness, inadequate water supply and non-functioning of street lights were also discussed. Councilors alleged that malpractices and lack of proper planning in infrastructural works in the vicinity of Taj Mahal and on Fatehabad road under the smart city project. They raised objections to long delays in completion of project works causing inconvenience to common people. Recently, chief minister Yogi Adityanath in a review meeting had expressed discontent over “unreasonable” delay in implementation of the central government scheme. Agra was selected under the smart city project in 2016. So far, none of the proposed development plan has been implemented. The Agra smart city project comprises 40 major development plans worth over Rs 1,000 crore. So far, Rs 313 crore has been released by the state government. Out of these, Rs 90.05 crore has so far been spent. Councilors demanded that AMC complete cleaning of nullahs, ahead of the monsoon within the next two weeks to avoid waterlogging in the city. Municipal commissioner Arun Prakash said, “The progress of smart city works will be reviewed on a daily basis. Pace of nullah cleaning works will be increased. Besides, all the other issues highlighted by the councilors will be addressed in a time-bound manner.” Meanwhile, a joint team of the municipal corporation, police and administration conducted an anti-encroachment drive in Mantola locality. Over a dozen encroachment over Mahavir nullaa which were in place since the past one decade were demolished. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Aligarh\u2019s government hospital CMS,.description: AGRA: Aligarh police has booked the chief medical superintendent (CMS) and her staff of the government's district women's hospital on charges of "kidnapping" a newborn boy after a couple lodged a complaint claiming that the hospital staff handed them just one child while the woman was carrying “twins”.According to complainant Satendra Kumar, his wife Sangeeta was under treatment at Aligarh’s Pt Deen Dayal Upadhyay Joint Hospital during her pregnancy. He claimed that during the course of treatment, three ultrasounds were conducted, in February, March, and May this year by the hospital staff, and according to the report, his wife was carrying “twins”. The complainant further said that his wife had delivered “twins” on June 9, at the district women’s hospital, but only a baby boy was given to the family members. He alleged that the doctors and nurses, who were on duty that day had "stolen" his second child. However, Aligarh senior superintendent of police Akash Kulhary told TOI that a doctors’ panel formed by the chief medical officer re-examined the radiologist’s report and found it to be “erroneous”. “Police investigation is still on though,” he said. Chief medical officer Dr ML Agarwal said that the medical panel concluded that no evidence was found to support the complainant’s claim of his wife giving birth to “twins”. Agarwal said that the hospital’s radiologist had admitted his mistake of wrongly mentioning “twins” in the report and action will be taken against him. Aruna Rai, SHO of Banna Devi police station in Tappal, told TOI that the CMS, an unidentified doctor and a nurse had been booked under sections 363 (kidnapping), and 120-B (criminal conspiracy) of IPC. When contacted, the visibly upset CMS said, “An FIR should have been lodged only after the panel’s decision.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" UP: RPF cop slaps TTE in Sangam Express.description: AGRA: A cop of the Railway Protection Force (RPF) was booked for allegedly slapping chief ticket inspector (CTI) of Sangam Express, after he was confronted for boarding upper class coach without ticket or pass. The incident took place at around 3:30am on Thursday, when Prayagraj bound train reached Etawah junction. The accused cop was identified as sub-inspector Mahesh Sharma, claimed to be attached with north central railway headquarters in Allahabad, while the victim is 40-year-old Harishankar Porwal, the chief ticket inspector of Sangam Express. Based on Porwal written complaint, government railway police of Etawah junction booked SI Mahesh Sharma under IPC sections 332 (Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty) and 504 (Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace). Along with accused officer Sharma, Etawah RPF constable RK Yadav too was booked for helping Sharma to escape from station after the incident. Speaking to TOI, Porwal said, “As soon the train reached Etawah junction, a young man in plainclothes boarded the AC-2 tier coach of Sangam Express. When I enquired about his ticket, the man claimed to be railway staff sub-inspector Mahesh Sharma. I asked him to show his identity card or railway pass, but he refused and misbehaved.” “Seeing his aggressiveness I confronted him, on which he slapped me. With the help of other TTEs and coach attendants we caught him and called RPF Etawah. But instead of helping us, one of the Etawah RPF constables helped the assailant to escape. In this entire incident, the train was delayed by 20 minutes. I reported the matter to my superiors and later lodged an FIR against two cops,” he added. Kamal Shankar, station house officer of GRP Etawah, said, “We are probing the matter and will take appropriate action based on findings of investigation.” Speaking to TOI on the condition of anonymity, a senior railway official said, “A similar incident occurred on April 12 with another TTE named Raja Rama Meena, where a RPF sub-inspector of Panki station boarded Kanpur bound Shatabdi Express while he was in plainclothes. The cop misbehaved with TTE when he confronted him for traveling in train without ticket or pass. An internal inquiry is still going on.” “Such unauthorised traveling by railway’s own employees really makes difficult job for TTEs,” he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMU allocates space for protest after Al.description: AGRA: After the receipt of Allahabad High Court order restraining protests at the main gate and within a 100 metre radius of the Aligarh Muslim University’s (AMU) administrative block and the vice-chancellor’s lodge, the varsity authorities on Wednesday designated a spot, near the campus’s duck point for protests. In its order, dated May 17, the copy of which was received by the university recently, the court has directed the district administration and the SSP, to ensure that no person is allowed to stage protest on the main gate of the university or within the 100 metre radius of the administrative block and vice-chancellor’s lodge. The court’s order came on a petition filed by the university in light of the protest and dharna being held by students who could not clear the Phd entrance examination. The protest has been going on for the past 59 days at the varsity’s main gate. Incidentally, in 2017, Delhi High Court prohibited protests within 100 metres of administrative and academic buildings in Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU), and also directed the university to designate a suitable place on the campus. The JNU administration had designated the Sabarmati Lawns for this purpose. In their petition, the AMU has stated that the protesting students have blocked the main entrance of administrative gate of the university, as such, causing hindrance in ingress and egress of the employees and officials of the administrative building. It was further stated that due to dharna, rally and procession, law and order situation has deteriorated and it has become difficult for university’s administrative authorities to carry out its day-to-day functioning. The court has also permitted the university to install CCTVs in front of administrative block and other relevant areas so that there can be a clear view of the area around the administrative block including the main gate. When contacted, the university registrar, Abdul Hamid, said that the court’s decision has come out as a major respite to the university as almost 50 protests have been held in the past one year. He said, “Following the court’s order, the university can now conduct academic activities in a peaceful manner.” He added that the university has informed the district administration and police chief about the same. Hamid added that the university administration has designated a spot for “democratic protests” by students. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Conman\u2019s cover was blown when he wa.description: AGRA: A 39-year-old conman, Soumyajeet Sanyal, who had been duping five-star hotels across the country by posing as a senior bureaucrat and availing free stay in them, was ultimately caught by a chauffeur of a BMW, which was provided to him by The Oberoi Amarvilas management for dropping him at the railway guest house in Agra Cantt station. According to police, the driver became suspicious when he saw Sanyal carrying a sack along with a carry bag. “We have recovered a plastic sack from Sanyal in which he was carrying fake government letters, ID cards and other credentials to influence hoteliers for free stay,” said Sanjay Kumar Pandey, Tajganj station house officer. A senior police official said, “Sanyal is so well-versed with various government offices, posts and senior officials’ identities, that he threw names of officials and political leaders on hoteliers to show his connection with them. In fact, he often would claim to be a member of the National Tourism Advisory Council since 2014. Interestingly, the council was set up in 2016, which hardly any hotelier cross checked. Sanyal knew that often in Indian hotels, staff don’t question senior government officials about their details.” From Sanyal, police recovered scores of visiting cards of government officials and politicians, along with alleged fake letters written on government notepad, two annual reports of Indian Tourism Development Council and a book named, ‘Positioning the battle for your mind’, which deals in problems of communicating to a skeptical, media-blitzed public. Just as he duped other hotel managements, he did the same thing with the staff of The Oberoi Amarvilas, police said. After dinner on Thursday night, he was provided a BMW for Agra Cantt- based railway guest house. He fooled railway officials too for staying in their guest house, added the official. “There is CCTV footage of the hotel, where he seen boarding the BMW, but it is not clear if he was carrying the sack in the car too,” said Taj security CO Mohammad Mohshin Khan. On Friday, DM, Agra, N G Ravi Kumar was around The Oberoi Amarvilas, when the hotel staff asked him to help them in ascertaining the genuineness of Sanyal’s credentials, who was refusing to pay for Friday’s lunch, after having Thursday night’s dinner for free. Speaking to TOI, additional divisional railway manager of Agra, Mudit Chandra, said, “Sanyal was a very deceitful person. He claimed to be member of the National Tourism Advisory Council and a friend of a railway board official. Initially, he asked for an hour’s stay in the retiring room (AC) of Agra Cantt station, but later, he went on to ask for a stay in the railway guest house. On Friday morning, suspecting that something was amiss, we asked him to vacate the guest house but before that he stole our staff phone.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Etah honour killing: Autopsy report says.description: AGRA: Days after the bodies of young unmarried couple were found hanging from a tree in a remote village of Etah district, police on Wednesday claimed that the autopsy report suggests hanging with no external or internal injury marks. In a suspected honour killing, victims Satya Prakash Singh Yadav (23) of Kayampur village and Pooja Yadav (20) of Ladampur Katara village were found in a field around 100 meters away from the girl’s house on early Tuesday. Speaking to TOI, Aliganj circle officer Ajay Bhadauria said, “The autopsy mentions hanging, but we are still probing the matter. The girl’s parents, who were reportedly absconding after the couple’s death, have returned and conducted the last rite of the girl. We are now questioning them to ascertain the exact cause of the death. We hope to crack the case by Thursday.” On Tuesday, an FIR under charges of murder was lodged against unknown person by Nayagaon police. Police sources claimed that Pooja and Satya Prakash were in a relationship and wanted to marry. But the girl’s family was reportedly against it. The source added that few weeks ago the couple had even eloped, but returned after they were assured by Pooja’s family that they would be married to each other. But the girl was taken to her maternal grandmother’s house where she was confined. “A couple of days ago Pooja returned Ladampur Katara village. Satya Prakash too came to her house to meet her and days later they were found murdered. It his highly probable that the girl’s family members may have killed them,” said an official source. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Carrying weapons to court premises was n.description: AGRA: Before the murder of UP Bar Council chairperson on the Agra court premises, carrying weapons inside court was a normal practice — an open secret accepted by the lawyer fraternity. “No one used to check or question the practice of carrying weapons on the court premises, even as a high court notification categorically prohibits arms inside the court,” said district government council (DGC-criminal) Basant Gupta. Gupta said, “Had there been a proper security apparatus present in and around the court, in lines with the Supreme Court and high courts, Darvesh Yadav would have been alive today. But, such incidents bring to fore the loop holes present in our system. Although the new security parameter enforced on Thursday looks promising in this regard, the question, however, is how long this arrangement is going to last?” Vivek Sarabhoy, a civil lawyer at Agra court, said, “As frisking by police at the court’s entry gates takes lot of time, many lawyers are already annoyed with it. Every vehicle and person is checked properly. But, with the temperature soaring 46 degrees Celsius and the checking being a time consuming process, it irritates many.” “The security parameter has made the court safer than ever before, but police need to adopt more effective measures to make the court premises safer without troubling the visitors and lawyers,” he added. Darvesh Yadav was, however, not the first casualty inside the court premises in Agra. In early 90s, advocate Ram Khiladi Verma was shot dead at the court entrance, while some five years ago, advocate Omveer Chahhar was attacked near the parking lot. An advocate on the condition of anonymity said, “Lawyers carry weapons or armed escorts to the court premises as they deal with hard core criminals, who pose grave threat to them. Most of the times a lawyer spends his day on the court premises and is exposed to scores of people and can be attacked by someone just because he might have got him convicted in a criminal case.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Read this story in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

3,300 out of school children identified.description: AGRA: Following orders of the state government, the basic education department had identified over 3,300 children who were out of schools. In first three months of the new session which started in April, all the identified students have been enrolled in the state government-run primary schools. They will be attending regular classes from July after end of the summer vacation. However, the data compiled by the basic education department indicate that the state government’s special program named ‘Sharda – School Har Din Ayein’ for enrollment of out of school children ended in a formality in rural areas. According to the official data, in city areas and 15 blocks of Agra district teachers identified 3,332 children between age group of 6 to 14 who were not going to school. Out of these 1,063 were enrolled in city areas, whereas in entire Fatehpur Sikri block only seven children were found not going to school. Ahead of the new session, state government had directed that teachers should step out of schools to identify children not going to school. Teachers were required to spread awareness about benefits of education especially among weaker sections of the society, and ensure no child is left to get benefit of free education. In city areas, teachers took out rallies to promote the Sharda program. Non-government organisations also made efforts for enrollment of the out of school children. Apart from city area, 413 out of school children were enrolled in Jagner block, 370 in Kheragarh, 264 in Baroli Ahir, 210 in Pinahat, 201 in Khandoli, 161 in Bichpuri, 12 in Fatehabad, 114 in Jaitpur Kalan, 94 in Shamshabad, 85 in Fatehabad, 50 in Bah, 46 in Achhnera, 43 in Saiyan, 39 in Akola and seven in Fatehpur Sikri. District in-charge of the Sarv Shiksha Abhiyan said, “The admission process will continue till September end. After reopening of schools in July, second round of campaign to identify out of school children will be launched. This time the focus will be on rural areas. Teachers will reach every doorstep to take children to school. Officials will also make efforts to ensure every child goes to school.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Agra: Conman who used to pose as governm.description: AGRA: A 39-year-old impostor who claimed to be a bureaucrat from West Bengal was arrested from The Oberoi Amarvilas in Agra on Friday. Identified as Soumyajeet Sanyal, a resident of Salt Lake, Kolkata, the conman, who stayed in luxury hotels and resorts and fled without clearing his bills, was booked under IPC sections 419 (punishment for cheating by personation) and 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property) by Tajganj police. Tajganj station house officer Sanjay Kumar Pandey said, “Sanyal would throw names of officials and political leaders to get free stay and food in high-end hotels. On Thursday, he stayed in Yamuna Railway Rest House and had lunch at The Oberoi Amarvilas by introducing himself as a member of the national tourism advisory council. On Friday, he again returned to The Oberoi Amarvilas but this time, he was confronted by staff to pay his bill. When he refused, cops were called by hotel staff and his bluff was called out.” On his Facebook and Linkedin profiles, Sanyal claims to be an alumnus of Institute of Chartered Financial Analysts of India, Hyderabad, from where he pursued MBA and studied tourism management from West Bengal University of Technology. He also claimed to be head of public relations, consultant and advisor to various government departments, like tourism, HRD, petroleum, transport, civil aviation, information-culture-broadcasting and others. On his social media accounts, he also shares selfies with Bollywood actors, like Farhan Akhtar, singer Abhijeet Bhattacharya, yoga guru Ramdev and several politicians. Senior superintendent of police Jogendra Kumar said, “There is very high probability that conman Soumyajeet Sanyal would have duped many hotels and other institutes across the country. We are going to question him in detail to understand the web of his conmanship and the reasons behind it.” According to the FIR lodged by sub-inspector Ashok Kumar, Soumyajeet Sanyal had even stolen a mobile phone of an employee of a private guest house based near Agra Cantt station where he stayed briefly. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMU students\u2019 union removes \u2018s.description: AGRA: A few hours after the Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) designated the varsity’s duck point as a ‘dharna site’ by putting a board there, members of the students’ union removed the same on the plea that it was a “symbol of tyranny”. The university authorities had designated the ‘dharna site’ after Allahabad high court restrained protests at the varsity’s main gate and within 100 metres of the administrative block and the vice-chancellor lodge. President of students’ union, Salman Imtiaz, uploaded photographs of students removing the board on social media claiming that the “symbol of tyranny had been removed from the campus”. In his Facebook post, the president said that AMU authorities cannot impose a place of protest on the students. He said, “I, as the president of AMUSU, have already rejected this authoritarianism of the university officials. We have the legitimate right to question the university authorities in a peaceful manner, whenever anti-student policies are framed or corrupt practices are found.” He further said that protests in a democratic country are a legitimate right and powers that be cannot act in a tyrannical manner. Talking to TOI, Imtiaz said that several protests have been held in the campus in a peaceful manner, but the administrative authorities portray the current protest as an “obstruction” to academic and administrative functioning, which is absolutely incorrect. AMUSU’s vice-president Hamza Sufyan said, “We are not satisfied with the decision of administrative authorities designating the ‘dharna site’ in the campus. To protest is our fundamental right and we can do it wherever we want.” He added that they will file a review petition in the court and if it is not accepted, they would challenge the HC order in the Supreme Court. Sufyan told TOI that last month on May 4, the AMU authorities had allotted space for protests near the university’s polytechnic, but they had withdrawn their decision after the intervention of students’ union. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Property dealer murdered in Mathura.description: AGRA: A 43-year-old property dealer was allegedly shot dead by his former business partner over a land dispute in Mathura’s Aanyor village on Friday afternoon. The victim has been identified as Jhamman Chaudhary. According to police, the incident occurred after 12:00 pm, when the accused Durgpal Singh (35) came to meet Jhamman at his plot. Singh allegedly started abusing the deceased which led to an argument, following which Singh shot Jhamman and fled the spot. Local residents took Jhamman to a private hospital, where the doctors declared him brought dead. According to doctors, the deceased was shot on the right side of his chest. Jhamman, who was the elder brother of a TV journalist in Mathura, was business partner of the accused earlier, said police. A case of murder has been registered against the accused at Govardhan police station and the deceased’s body has been sent for post mortem. The deceased’s brother Ravi Chaudhary told mediapersons that his brother was being harassed by Singh over some land dispute but he never thought that the accused would kill him. Senior superintendent of Police Shalabh Mathur said that there was no evidence of any previous dispute but the matter is being probed. He said that further investigations are on and the suspect will be arrested soon. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Agra doctor held for hiring shooters to.description: AGRA: Monitoring movement of a recently released contract-killer from jail helped Agra police to prevent the murder of a gym trainer and landed a city-based orthopedician in jail. The 33-year-old orthopedician, who practises at his father's private clinic in Bagh Farzana area of Civil Lines, was arrested late on Friday evening for plotting murder of gym trainer Tarun Gupta who he suspected was having an affair with his wife, who's a gynaecologist. TOI is withholding the accused doctor's name to protect the identity of his wife. Three other men, including Deepak Singh, the doctor's driver, Rajat Singh, a private pathology employee, and contract killer Satveer, who hails from Firozabad district, were also arrested. Anuj Kumar, station house officer of Sikandra, told TOI, "After monitoring the movement of shooter Satveer and his aide Vikas, we found that two were planning to eliminate a gym trainer. We picked up Satveer and interrogated him. During investigation, he spilled the beans." According to police, Satveer claimed in his confession that the doctor's driver Deepak had contacted Rajat Singh for a contract killing. The three, including the doctor, met Satveer and Vikas at a cafe in Sanjay Place and offered Rs 5 lakh to eliminate gym trainer Tarun Gupta. Later, the orthopedician also took the two contract killers in his car to identify the gym trainer and show them his residence. "During questioning, the doctor claimed that he suspected his wife was having an affair with the gym trainer. He also claimed that he had sought help of his parents-in-law to end the affair but it didn't help. That's when he decided to hire a killer to get him eliminated," the SHO said. Police said CCTV footages also confirmed the doctor's meetings with the contract killer. Police recovered a .32 calibre country-made pistol with three cartridges from the contract killer. All the four accused have been booked under IPC's sections 107 (abetment of a thing) and 115 (abetment of offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life-if offence is not committed). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Possibility of thunderstorm, district ad.description: AGRA: The district administration on Friday issued an advisory following weather prediction by the MET department’s Lucknow branch. Thunderstorm, accompanied with gusty winds blowing at a speed of 30-40 kilometers per hour, may be witnessed in the district in the three days. Besides, there is possibility of lightning and rainfall at isolated places. With high humidity and partially cloudy sky, maximum temperature was recorded at 44 degrees Celsius while the minimum temperature was recorded at 30.1 degrees Celsius. Additional district magistrate (finance and revenue), Ramesh Chandra, said, “Following possibility of thunderstorm predicted by the MET department, an advisory has been issued for the safety of people and property. The unfavorable weather condition may continue till June 18. People are advised not to drive during thunderstorm. Vehicles should be parked at safe places. People should avoid standing under a tree, hording, electricity pole or staying in dilapidated premises and to keep drinking water in reserve. People should take precautions to avoid infections. In case of emergency, people can dial 100 to contact the control room.” Superintendent in-chief of Agra district hospital, Subodh Kumar, said, “To avoid illness in the present weather condition, people should drink a lot of water and other fluids, maintain sanitation and hygiene, consume fruits and take oral rehydration salts (ORS) in case of diarrhoea and vomiting.” According to the MET department, maximum temperature is likely to decrease by 4 to 5 degrees celsius after June 19. Parts of western Uttar Pradesh may witness below-average rainfall. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ticketless RPF cop slaps chief TTE when.description: AGRA: A Railway Protection Force (RPF) sub-inspector was booked for allegedly slapping the chief travelling ticket examiner (TTE) of Sangam Express train after he was confronted for boarding an upper class coach without a ticket or pass. The incident took place at about 3:30 am on Thursday, when the Prayagraj-bound train reached Etawah junction. The RPF personnel was identified as sub-inspector Mahesh Sharma, who claimed to be attached with North Central Railway headquarters in Allahabad. The chief TTE of Sangam Express was identified as 40-year-old HarishankarPorwal. Based on Porwal’s written complaint, Government Railway Police of Etawah junction booked SI Sharma under IPC sections 332 (voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty)and 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace). Along with Sharma, Etawah RPF constable R K Yadav too was booked for helping the former to flee from the station after the incident. Speaking with TOI, Porwal said, “As soon the train reached Etawah junction, a young man in plain clothes boarded the AC 2-tier coach of Sangam Express. When I enquired about his ticket, the man claimed to be railway staff sub-inspector Mahesh Sharma. I asked him to show his identity card or railway pass, but he refused and misbehaved. “Seeing his aggressiveness. I confronted him and he retaliated by slapping me. With the help of other TTEs and coach attendants, we caught him and called the RPF. Etawah. But instead of helping us, one Etawah RPF constable helped the assailant to escape. Due to this entire incident, the train was delayed by 20 minutes. I reported the matter to my superiors and later, lodged an FIR against the RPF personnel,” he added. Kamal Shankar, station house officer of GRP, Etawah, said, “We are probing the matter and will take appropriate action based on findings of the investigation.” Speaking with TOI, a senior railway official said, “A similar incident occurred on April 12 with another TTE named Raja Rama Meena. An RPF SI of Panki station boarded the Kanpur-bound Shatabdi Express while he was in plain clothes. The SI misbehaved with the TTE when he confronted him for traveling in the train without a ticket or pass. An internal enquiry is still going on.” He added, “Such unauthorized traveling by railway’s own employees really makes difficult the job for TTEs, who are later reprimanded or even suspended if any untoward incident happens in train,” he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In Agra, woman puts chilli powder on min.description: AGRA: Aligarh police on Sunday arrested a 55-year-old woman for allegedly torturing four minor boys in Khair area by putting chilli powder on their private parts. According to police, the incident occurred around 3:30 pm, when the four minor victims, all aged between six and eight, were playing outside their house with the accused’s granddaughter, who’s the same age. The accused, Munni Devi, who suspected the boys were sexually abusing the girl, forcibly took the boys inside her house and put chilli in their private parts. When the neighbours heard the children’s cries for help, they immediately informed the police and rescued the kids. All the victims were sent for medical examination, where doctors confirmed injuries on their private parts. The victims later told reporters that they had no clue why the elderly woman put chilli on their private parts. Khair circle officer Sanjeev Dixit told TOI that a case has been registered under sections 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 342 (wrongful confinement) of IPC and section 3/4 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Two Delhi men killed in road accident on.description: AGRA: Two men from Delhi, working in a private firm in Agra, were killed in a road accident on Yamuna expressway. The victims, identified as Ajit (25) and Pawan (24) of Mayur Nagar, Phase III of New Delhi were found dead in a pool of blood, near milestone 77 of Naujheel police jurisdiction of Mathura district on Friday night around 8:30 pm, by a patrolling team of private concessionaire, operating on the Yamuna expressway. The team informed the local police and the bodies were sent for autopsy. Speaking to TOI, SP Sharma, station house officer of Naujheel, said, “The two victims were on a motorbike and could’ve possibly been hit by a speeding hatchback registered in Mathura RTO. The car had big dent on its bonnet and was left by its driver after the accident. We have seized the car and are searching for the unidentified accused involved in the accident.” “The motor-bike was thrown off the expressway stretch and the two bodies were found several meters away, near the expressway fencing. It seems that the victims were on the left side of the stretch and the speeding car rammed them from behind. The driver of the car could have fallen asleep or been intoxicated,” Sharma added. The relatives of the two victims were informed about the incident. By the time this report was filed, an FIR in the matter was yet to be registered.” Meanwhile, in another road accident on Saturday afternoon at around 3:30 pm, three occupants of a hired taxi were found injured on Yamuna expressway in Mathura district. The victims were taken to the hospital and were said to be in stable condition. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Aligarh MP \u2018targets\u2019 Musli.description: AGRA: Aligarh’s BJP MP Satish Gautam has landed himself in a controversy by targeting the entire Muslim community for the crime committed by the two alleged killers of the two-and-a-half-year-old-girl, who was brutally murdered last week in Tappal town of the district over a financial dispute. Demanding harshest punishment for the two accused while talking to reporters after the ‘havan’ organized in the child’s memory on Wednesday, Gautam said: “They will be punished in such a manner that no one from their entire community would ever dare commit such a crime again”. Gautam’s remark has evoked sharp reactions. Congress leader and former Samajwadi party MLA, Zameer Ullah Khan, accused the MP of playing politics. He said criminals didn’t have any religion or caste and hence targeting the entire Muslim community for the crime committed by two people was unjustified. “I am writing a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi about Gautam’s utterances as it’s against BJP’s claims of being a party working for ‘sabka sath, sabka vikas and sabka vishwas”. He added that Gautam’s statement had defamed the entire Muslim community. The police have arrested four persons, including the prime accused Zahid Ali, his wife, Shabusta, brother Mehndi Hassan and his associate Aslam, in connection with the brutal killing of the girl. Her mutilated body was spotted by a cleaner when stray dogs were dragging it from a garbage pile on June 3, three days after her abduction. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Uttar Pradesh: Man kills wife for refusi.description: AGRA: Aligarh police on Friday arrested two persons, including the husband of a 32-year-old woman, who was allegedly killed for refusing to have sexual relations with a tantrik so that the family could become “rich”. According to the police, the woman, Rajni, was drowned in Ganga river by her husband, Maanpal Singh (35) on Wednesday, after she refused to have sex with the tantrik, Santdas Jharkhandi, who hails from Bihar. Her body was left in the river and it was recovered by the divers on Thursday night. Police said that the deceased’s brother Rajesh Singh had lodged a complaint against his brother-in-law Maanpal on Thursday for allegedly killing his sister. Acting on Singh’s complaint, police immediately lodged a search operation and engaged almost a dozen divers to recover the deceased’s body from the river. Singh told police that he went to his sister’s house on Wednesday before taking a holy dip in the river on the occasion of Ganga Dussehra. During their conversation, Rajni told her brother about the tantrik and his offer of making her husband rich, if she developed sexual relations with him. Rajesh advised his brother-in-law to stay away from the tantrik and left the house. According to the deceased family, the couple got married nine years ago. Rajni’s husband, who was working in his own farmland, started taking drugs after he came in contact with the tantrik. Police said that the accused was a good swimmer and left the deceased’s body in the middle of the river so that no one can locate it. Talking to media, senior superintendent of police, Akash Kulhary, said that both the accused have been arrested within 24 hours of the incident. He said that the tantrik was a drug addict and he was earlier nabbed with 700 gram heroin with his associates by the Mathura police. Kulhary said that the accused have confessed to the crime. A case has been registered under sections 302 (murder), 201 (Causing disappearance of evidence of offence), 120 B (criminal conspiracy), 504 (Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace), 506 (criminal intimidation), and 323 (voluntarily causes hurt) of IPC on the complaint filed by the deceased’s brother. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Agra court security up after bar cou.description: AGRA: A day after UP bar council woman chairperson Darvesh Yadav was shot dead inside Agra court premises, local police on Thursday strengthen the security parameter of the court with armed cops and metal detectors with iron barriers. Speaking to TOI, Mohammad Mohshin Khan, the CO security, said, “The court has five gates of which only two are used for entry and exit. But from now on armed cops will provide round-the-clock security on all gates, until the next security review assessment or order from superior authority of court.” He said, “No person shall bring any kind of weapon, explosive or prohibited substance inside the court premises. Barring VIP, every vehicle, bag and human will be checked thoroughly before being allowed to enter into the court. The cops have been given metal detector instruments to frisk each visitor at entry point. Only limited vehicles will be allowed to be parked inside the court premises. It would be first come first service.” Meanwhile, on Thursday a man returning from marriage function with license rifle in a hatchback attempted to enter inside district court premises, but was detained by cops. “During questioning, the man claimed that he wasn’t aware of new security parameter and had come to visit consumer forum for his vehicle’s insurance claim case,” said SHO Ajay Kaushal of New Agra police station. By the time this report was filed, local police was still questioning the man. Earlier in the day, national commission for women chairperson Rekha Sharma too visited Agra court premises and expressed her displeasure over the armed weapon being brought inside court premises. Speaking to media, Rekha Sharma said, “Why should lawyers or anyone be allowed to bring weapon inside court premises. We will write to Bar Council of India and UP bar council to ensure that no weapon is allowed in court premises. It’s extremely disappointing that an advocate was shot dead inside court by her own colleague.” “I’ll submit my finding report to Home Minister very soon,” she added after observing the security parameter of the court. State law minister Brijesh Pathak while visiting to Darvesh Yadav's native village to attend her last rite said, "All the district administrations have been asked to provide full security parameter to local courts. There should be no breach of security." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman and 2 kids charred to death at hom.description: AGRA: A woman and her two children were found charred to death in suspicious circumstances inside their home in Etah district. The incident took place in Ujjaipur village of Etah Dehat Kotwali police jurisdiction. Victims were identified as 25-year-old Kanti Devi and her two children Lavish (4) and Aarti (2). Their charred bodies were recovered by police, after local residents informed the cops about smoke and pungent smell coming from their home. Later, based on a written complaint of Kanti Devi’s father Atraj Singh, Dehat Kotwali police booked Kanti’s husband Awadesh Kumar and her in-law Pankaj under IPC sections 498A (husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), 304B (dowry death) and ¾ dowry act. After the incident, the two accused were found missing. Speaking to TOI, Ajitpal Singh, station house officer of Dehat Kotwali, said, “The main door of victim’s house was locked from inside. After extracting the charred remains of three victims, they were sent for autopsy.” “Kanti’s father alleged that the couple was often engaged in heated arguments. They were married for five years, but did not have a cordial relation. Suicide bid cannot be ruled out, but it can only be ascertained after we arrest the accused and interrogate for sequence of event which led to the three deaths,” he added. Eight of a family among nine killed in r.description: AGRA: Eight members of a family were among nine killed in two separate road accidents on Yamuna Expressway in Mathura and Agra districts. The eight victims were on their way to Agra to visit Taj Mahal, when their hatchback allegedly rammed into the rear of a truck, registered with Karnataka’s regional transport office (RTO). The victims belonged to Jewar of Gautam Buddh Nagar district and Khurja and Pahasu of Bulandshahr. In another road accident on Yamuna Expressway on Saturday at 12:53 am, a sedan rammed into iron railing and turned turtle. The accident occurred at milestone 156 of Khandauli police jurisdiction of Agra district. According to police, the accident - where eight members of a family were killed - occurred at 8:40 am near milestone 140 under Baldeo police jurisdiction of Mathura district. The victims were identified as Neeraj (25), wife of Prem Chand; Anita (30), wife of Shiv Kumar; Anjali (13), daughter of Shiv Kumar; Vishnu (25), son of Suresh; Karuna (22), daughter of Sulekh; Shalu (19), daughter of Jai Prakash; Santoshi (20) and Gabbar Singh (25), sons of Brahm Singh. Major (retired) Manoj Manish Singh, manager of Yamuna Expressway, Mathura section, told TOI, “The hatchback was probably cruising at a very high speed." He added, "There was nothing left of the mangled car. Expressway rescue team which reached the location in six minutes, found six bodies along with two grievously injured trapped inside the car. We immediately rushed the victims to the nearest hospital.” They died during treatment. Station house officer of Baldeo, Sunil Kumar Singh, said, “The car had rammed into the rear of a truck, which suggest either the car’s driver fell asleep on steering wheel, or the truck driver applied sudden brakes in the middle of the road. After the accident, the truck driver fled in his vehicle. The truck’s number plate was found at the accident site, which was registered with Karnataka RTO.” “Bodies of all the eight victims have been sent for autopsy and a written complaint has been taken from their relative to lodge an FIR,” he added. Prem Chand, husband of deceased Neeraj, said, “Around 16 members of our distant family were travelling to Agra to visit Taj Mahal in two cars via Yamuna Expressway. We all had left for Agra from Khurja on Saturday night and had a brief stay at my in-law’s home in Naujheel of Mathura district. We resumed our journey on Sunday morning. I was driving my van and ferrying all male members of the family, including my two children. When the accident took place, we were 10-12 km away from the hatchback and had no idea about the tragedy.” “All eight members of my family, including my wife, niece and friend, were killed,” said Prem Chand, who runs a small store of electrical items in Jewar. In the other road accident, the car’s four occupants hailed from Delhi and were on their way to Bihar to attend a wedding, the police said. One of the victims, identified as Pawan Bhambhani (35), succumbed while being treated at a hospital. His three friends - Lalit Thapa, Arun Bhewal and Manto - suffered injuries. According to expressway rescue team, the sedan was also struck by another speeding car. A source from Yamuna expressway claimed that occupants of the sedan were in an inebriated state and were speeding when the accident took place. Rohit Bhambhani, deceased victim's brother said, "Pawan was not inebriated when accident occurred. The autopsy report has confirmed it." A total of 4,956 accidents, 718 deaths and 7,671 serious injuries were recorded on the Yamuna Expressway between August 2012 and March 31, 2018, an RTI reply had revealed. In this period, a total of 2.33 crore vehicles violated speed limits, data provided by automatic surveillance gadgets and number plate readers installed at various points showed. However, only 17,883 were issued challans by traffic police in four UP districts of Agra, Aligarh, Mathura and Gautam Budh Nagar. Data available from the Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) revealed that 23.42% accidents were caused due to speeding while 12% were due to tyre bursts. Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. No relief from heatwave for next three d.description: AGRA: There was no relief in the Taj city as mercury crossed the 44 degrees Celsius mark giving the citizens and the tourists a blow of intense heatwave. The hot wind that started blowing before the afternoon, continued till evening. Humidity only added to the woes of the people. On Saturday, both maximum and minimum temperatures was recorded to be 3 degrees Celsius above normal. The maximum temperature was recorded 44.1 degree Celsius whereas minimum temperature remained at 30.6 degrees Celsius. With the humidity level exceeding 39% and the heat wave flowing at a speed of 10 kilometer per hour, the traffic was scant on MG road and market places remained deserted. Meanwhile, there was a rush of patients at the district hospital and SN Medical College. A majority of the cases were of dehydration and heat stroke. According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), on Sunday, city can witness partly cloudy sky with possibility of rain or thunderstorm. The average temperature is likely to decrease. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal.
